Package View_Controller

Class UpdateCustomerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_Controller.UpdateCustomerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class UpdateCustomerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for updating existing customer information

      Retrieves and stored the selected customer and enables the population of customer fields with information specific to that customer.

      Combo box which displays the selected customer's state or province info and allows for it to be changed / edited.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the UpdateCustomerController Class. initialize handles populating all of the relevant and editable customer customer information fields based on the specific customer selected from the main customer screen. The values for 1st level division data (country and state / province) are set similar to the other specific customer info, however each combo box must be populated with the corresponding info from the database. Thus each combo is surrounded by try/catch block to handle the potential SQLException in retrieving that information.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        resourceBundle - LAMBDA EXPRESSION(S) - In an effort to minimize huge blocks of code in an already complex method, several lambda expressions iterate over a list of division object info and adds to a list of strings which is used to populate the combo boxes. Within this method, 5 separate lambdas operate in the same way for each country and division. This implementation helps in not having to write larger for loops for each country and division list.

      • updateStateCombo

        public void updateStateCombo​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This method updates the 'State / Division' combo box with the appropriate information based on the country selected from the 'Country' combo box. Three main countries can be selected (Canada, United Kingdom, United States). When a country is chosen, the database is queried for 1st-level division information related to that country and populates the state / province combo box with related names.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - user clicking / selecting a specific country. RUNTIME ERROR - Each selection queries the database and thus has potential to throw a SQLException. A try/catch block is implemented for each country selection. LAMBDA EXPRESSIONS - The lambdas within this method operate similar to those found in the controllers initialization. They help to minimize code needed to loop through a list of objects and add to a list to populate combo boxes interacted with by the user. 3 such expressions exist within this method.

      • saveCustomer

        public void saveCustomer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This method takes the information entered in the editable fields of the user interface and updates the stored customer in the database.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Triggered by the 'Save' button: passes the text field and combo box information to the updateCustomer method which executes specific SQL statement to save the updated customer. Additionally, it call a scene change method which sets the screen title, scene, and displays main customer window. RUNTIME ERROR(S) - IOException and SQLException handled through try/catch and error messages are printed to the console. LOGIC CHECK - Ensures all customer fields must be filled out. If any are discovered empty, the user is prompted to correct the missing fields.

      • returnToCustomer

        public void returnToCustomer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This method directs the user to the Customers menu. Selecting the 'Cancel' button changes the scene and loads the FXML file of the main screen.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Triggered by the 'Cancel' button: sets the screen title, scene, and displays the window. RUNTIME ERROR results in an IOException in the event it cannot locate the FXML source file. Upon catching the exception an error message is printed to the console.
